replies.body:
Exact changes are still under discussion. General problem statement is that it's too universal. Having all your abilities slow is something that should be a deliberate choice you opt into, and make trade offs for, not just a default item on so many AP champs. That issue's magnified by the HP given by Rylai's, given health's the most universal stat we've got (everyone can always use it, and more's always useful, even if it's not the ideal stat for a specific champ).

One of the directions we're considering is a pretty dramatic change that strips the health off entirely, replacing it with mana or something like mana+CDR. That's got some substantial cost to it, given it effectively removes Rylai's as an option for a lot of champs who have traditionally bought it. Possible it's the healthiest approach however. It might also mean we'd want to make other slowing items (Dead Man's Plate, Randuin's Omen or GLP) better options for champs no longer able to use Rylai's well. 

Another possible direction's to strip AP, and possibly slow strength, off Rylai's instead. Big advantage there is that that would preserve more of its historic niche. Risk is that it remains too universal given the health, or that we have to hit it so hard in terms of AP/passive strength that it's just mediocre for everyone.

More thoughts to follow, likely around the time 6.22 (tentative Pre-Season patch) hits the PBE. Very much an ongoing discussion for us at the moment, with people arguing for a range of different approaches here.

Giving it Mana and CDR would not only increase it being bought on the certain champion demographic it's been problematic on but would screw over some of the mana less casters that really like it in their build ({{champion:8}} {{champion:68}} {{champion:82}} )

The problem with it isn't exactly the health in my opinion as most mages don't have the resistances to back it up and it thus scales rather bad into the later stages of the game but it offering both high ap and health and being constantly rushed is a real problem.

A lot of people complain about Rylais on champions like Cassiopeia and Azir who would become even greater annoyances if it becomes a big ticked damage item, a slowing one nonetheless that makes it not only hard for their opponents to escape but give them strong damage to back the slow up.

If it were to be tankier and less AP centric it would take those who buy it more time to stick on the opponent to get their damage off but have longer to kill them due to it simply not offering a lot in terms of offensive power.

That's what most people complain about.
It's not the health, it's the slow being tied to such a big ticked damage item that makes it hard to actually avoid the damage since you're being slowed to a crawl.

The latter option would really work out IMO seeing that it's what it used to be in the past and would make it an OPTION for a lot of champions rather than what will almost become a necessity on a smaller champion pool (squishy mages)
something along the lines of 60-80 AP and 400+ health would be really cool with chipping off power off the AoE slow for example, changing it into something like 30%


Another idea, that would be kinda funky would be making it TWO items!
Having one component that builds into either 
A) a tankier utility option with a stronger slow but a lot less AP
B) the mana/cdr one with no defensive stats but more AP
Splitting into two items would be a great way to ensure no class of champions gets screwed. I like that idea a lot.

Me too! I made an attempt at an example for this a little while ago:
https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/55fmqi/idea_for_a_rylais_rework/

I think that Metal's suggestion is actually better, to make two items "complete" into a rylais with whatever new passive it gets. Before I was trying to keep Rylais passive mostly as is, but just make it so that you can't get it very early on.

edit:clarity
The other big problem is, that there are very few alternatives for mages who want big ap items
The only one you need is the fedora. {{item:3089}}

Not like blue buff also increased ap by 15%

And don't try to tell me people actually built Rylais AND Ludens.

Most people would just replace Rylais with ludens and get the same amount of AP

While losing all of the utility. I play a lot of rumble and that alow helps keep the damage on champs that are faste, or dash all over the world (or keeps them from just dadhing out of my ult). Ludens is good for those bursty mages, but does eff all as a replacement for Rumble.

Luden's wouldn't be a huge failure for rumble. His low C/D's and need for movement speed are both good with the item. Surely it's worse than Rylai's and I would never argue against that, but Rylai's as it stands is way way too busted on every champion involved.

Honestly if Rylai's didn't synergize with Liandry's you'd probably not buy it as often anyway before the MYMU. It just so happens to double Liandry's damage, that synergizes with Rumble's Q.

He could also easily get away with just buying proto>liandry>zhonya>dcap>void and still be insanely powerful.

{{item:3116}} helps Rumble stick on people and actually get all his damage off.

{{item:3285}} is NOT a Rumble item. It just gives some burst, and Rumble is not a burst champion, he is a sustain damage/dot champion.

So yes, {{item:3285}} over {{item:3116}} would in fact be a failure on Rumble. He does NOT need movement speed on an item outside of boots, as he already has his W for that. The little splash damage thing does little to nothing for Rumble. It currently has the same AP, but non of the same utility, and no health (which while not his number one stat, it helps, him stay alive just long enough to get off all his damage if he is going 1v1 in lane). 

Also you are wrong, again, as {{item:3151}} has nothing to do with why I want {{item:3116}}. {{item:3116}} helps keep people in his ult, that otherwise just walk out of it like nothing happened, helps keep you on them if you Q them or forces them to have to flash out. {{item:3151}} has very little to do with it, and this is from a Mastery 7 Rumble.

Also, it isn't just about "power". It doesn't matter how much damage you do if you can't stick onto someone long enough to actually do it (hence the issue with it being derped down for Morde as well). You are clearly missing the point, and the dps on it has little to nothing to do with it to be quite honest in comparison to the sticking power and utility on champions that have little to none otherwise and NEED it.

Can we do it different. as somewhere stated below is the following point: Spammy / Refreshing  with **speedboosts **champions like {{champion:69}} {{champion:112}} {{champion:90}}  are a problem here  - same issue as with {{champion:150}}  & {{item:3022}} .

In my shitty silver oppinion, Rylais and Mallet are FINE.  They need a cap on how often you can refresh that slow. something like diminishing returns slow 1 40 % slow 2 35 % and so on.

{{item:3022}}  got already nerfed. {{item:3116}}  needs a slight hit to AP so more Mages consider {{item:3027}}  as their go to Item - as atm it gets completely outclassed.

Hey this is an idea I just had for maybe helping make Rylais less all around good and also making Luden's better which is an item also in a sorta bad spot due to having a passive that quickly gets outscaled by other items.  

For one, Rylais loses some AP to be in the 60-80 range and keeps its passive (for the most part at least) and the large amount of HP.  Probably would get a slight cost reduction with the loss of HP but now it makes a meaningful tradeoff of being the utility/tank mage option.  

Second, we make Luden's a better option for the mages that just want dmg and better kiting potential and whenever Luden's passive is procced they get a burst of movespeed that rapidly decays over 2 or 3 seconds.  This still lets mages have a kiting option to survive without completely crushing the dreams of every melee champion in League of Legensds.  It also could be an option for AP bruisers that want to sacrifice tankiness for dmg and chase potential when snowballing.  

This may be completely awful idea but I figured I'd mention it.

You guys nerfed the passive for traditional users (single-target, moderate-low CD abilities), buffed it for non-traditional users (AoE/DoT), then nerfed the reason traditional users bought it (utility+HP on an AP item), and buffed the reason every mage in the game would want it (Highest AP outside of deathcap after all other AP items were nerfed).

How the fuck do you think adding mana/CDR to it would fix it?

Nerf the AP back down to 80, or even 60 to put it in line with other AP item nerfs. Buff the HP back to 500+. Revert the passive. Lower cost to relevant value.

WOWIEE. THE ITEM IS FUCKING BALANCED LIKE IT WAS BEFORE YOU FUCKED WITH IT**.

Jesus, I can't believe how idiotic you guys are about your balancing now. 

"LET'S DESTROY EVERYTHING THAT'S NOT WRONG WITH IT BECAUSE WE FUCKED IT UP IN THE FIRST PLACE WITH AN UNNECESSARY CHANGE. CAN'T POSSIBLY ADMIT WE, YOUR RIOT OVERLORDS, HAVE MADE A MISTAKE."

It has the same 'issues' you claim, but the only people that can successfully use it (despite one being ranged and one being melee) are ones who can abuse it to the point where everyone hates the item and the champions that can use it as a result.
Although I do agree with you, Rioters would probably take you a lot more seriously if you sounded calm.

I kinda have to agree here. The nerf that people want is just lowering the AP so it isn't a must have item since mages were so used to getting a lot of AP from their items before the scalings were cut. 

I don't think Meddler is stupid since I'm pretty sure they're just experimenting rather than trying to get things balanced. The preseason is a giant experiment after all and they aren't going to change it now.

Why shouldn't they buy it? Viktor is a battle mage after all. So is Azir. Champions that are forced to get closer than other mages and deal damage over time instead of in bursts. 

And yes, Morde would lose 40% gold efficiency. That's a good thing. Manaless champions should suffer from poor gold efficiency to pay for them never running oom.

Sir, do you realize Morde is balanced around the fact he has no mobility and CC too? He already can't use morello, archangel (If he could the shield would help him from getting insta cc bursted). Because reverting it solves all of the issues. It wasn't a major damage item before they messed it up.

Lower AP to 60, in line with all of the other AP item nerfs, buff HP. Item is fine then.
